result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:19 PM Defendant Shari L Broughton in court with Attorney Christopher William Duren.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued. 

Court adds Dane County Pretrial Services for remote breath monitoring. All other conditions remain the same.

Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:29 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies SPD but does not yet have counsel appointed. Defn waives time limits. Court sets STC for 2 weeks, notice sent to DCJ.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

03:09 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
